notes.title: if else
notes.snippet: if (condition) {   //  block of code to be executed if the condition is true } else {    //  block of code to be executed if the condition is false }
notes.note: Use the else statement to specify a block of code to be executed if the condition is false.

notes.title: Conditional (Ternary) Operator
notes.note: JavaScript also contains a conditional operator that assigns a value to a variable based on some condition.

notes.title: The Boolean() Function
notes.note: You can use the Boolean() function to find out if an expression (or a variable) is true:

notes.title: Math.round()
notes.note: Math.round(x) returns the value of x rounded to its nearest integer:

notes.title: Math.pow()
notes.note: Math.pow(x, y) returns the value of x to the power of y:

notes.title: Math.sqrt()
notes.note: Math.sqrt(x) returns the square root of x:

notes.title: JavaScript Data Types
notes.snippet: var length = 16;                               // Number var lastName = "Johnson";                      // String var x = {firstName:"John", lastName:"Doe"};    // Object
notes.note: JavaScript variables can hold many data types: numbers, strings, objects and more:

notes.title: While Loop
notes.snippet: while (i < 10) {   text += "The number is " + i;   i++; }
notes.note: The while loop loops through a block of code as long as a specified condition is true.

notes.note:
Bootstrap 4 is the newest version of Bootstrap; with new components, faster stylesheet and more responsiveness.

Bootstrap 4 supports the latest, stable releases of all major browsers and platforms. However, Internet Explorer 9 and down is not supported.

notes.title: constructor
notes.snippet: constructor(props) {   super(props);   this.state = {     list: props.initialList   }; }  // where props aren't used in constructor  constructor() {   super();   this.state = {     list: []   }; }

notes.title: componentDidMount
notes.note:
good for AJAX: fetch, ajax, or subscriptions.

   invoked once (client-side only). fires before initial 'render'

notes.title: componentWillReceiveProps
componentWillUpdate
notes.note:
invoked immediately before update (new props or state).
   does not fire before initial 'render'.

 (see componentWillReceiveProps if you need to call setState)
